comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. var opt = new Option('hello', 1); // or some other nr of params != 4 2. compile What is the expected output? No warning. All parameters in the constructor are optional. What do you see instead? "WARNING - Function Option: called with 2 argument(s). Function requires at least 4 argument(s) and no more than 4 argument(s)." What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Windows Vista. Closure 20100330 release Please provide any additional information below. see for example http://www.javascriptkit.com/jsref/select.shtml // Fredrik

Patch. this is the new annotation that should be attached to Option in the 
externs/deprecated.js file.
-------------------------------
/**
 * @param {string=} opt_text
 * @param {string=} opt_value
 * @param {boolean=} opt_defaultSelected
 * @param {boolean=} opt_selected
 * @constructor
 * @extends {Element}
 */
function Option(opt_text, opt_value, opt_defaultSelected, opt_selected) {}
--------------------------------------
This issue was closed by revision r178.
thanks! don't worry, we got it. it just got batched with some other changes.
